verses.verse: In the six <S%H8337><s%> and thirtieth <S%H7970><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of the reign <S%H4438><s%> of Asa, <S%H609><s%> Baasha <S%H1201><s%> king <S%H4438><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> went up <S%H5927><s%> against Judah, <S%H3063><s%> and built <S%H1129><s%> Ramah, <S%H7414><s%> that <S%H1115><s%> he might not allow <S%H5414><s%> anyone to go out <S%H3318><s%> or come in <S%H935><s%> to Asa <S%H609><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah. <S%H3063><s%>

Then Asa <S%H609><s%> brought out <S%H3318><s%> silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold <S%H2091><s%> out of the treasures <S%H214><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> and of the king <S%H4428><s%>'s house, <S%H1004><s%> and sent <S%H7971><s%> to Ben Hadad <S%H1130><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Syria, <S%H758><s%> who lived <S%H3427><s%> at Damascus, <S%H1834><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

"Let there be a treaty <S%H1285><s%> between me and you, <S%H1><s%> as there was between my father and your father. <S%H1><s%> Behold, <S%H7971><s%> I have sent you silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold. <S%H2091><s%> Go, <S%H3212><s%> break <S%H6565><s%> your treaty <S%H1285><s%> with Baasha <S%H1201><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> that he may depart from me. <S%H5927><s%>"

Ben Hadad <S%H1130><s%> listened <S%H8085><s%> to king <S%H4428><s%> Asa, <S%H609><s%> and sent <S%H7971><s%> the captains <S%H8269><s%> of his armies <S%H2428><s%> against the cities <S%H5892><s%> of Israel; <S%H3478><s%> and they struck <S%H5221><s%> Ijon, <S%H5859><s%> and Dan, <S%H1835><s%> and Abel Maim, <S%H66><s%> and all the storage <S%H4543><s%> cities <S%H5892><s%> of Naphtali. <S%H5321><s%>
It happened, <S%H1201><s%> when Baasha heard <S%H8085><s%> of it, <S%H2308><s%> that he left off building <S%H1129><s%> Ramah, <S%H7414><s%> and let his work <S%H4399><s%> cease. <S%H7673><s%>

Then Asa <S%H609><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> all Judah; <S%H3063><s%> and they carried away <S%H5375><s%> the stones <S%H68><s%> of Ramah, <S%H7414><s%> and its timber, <S%H6086><s%> with which Baasha <S%H1201><s%> had built; <S%H1129><s%> and he built therewith Geba <S%H1387><s%> and Mizpah. <S%H4709><s%>

At that time <S%H6256><s%> Hanani <S%H2607><s%> the seer <S%H7200><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to Asa <S%H609><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H8172><s%> "Because you have relied on the king <S%H4428><s%> of Syria, <S%H758><s%> and have not relied <S%H8172><s%> on Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> your God, <S%H430><s%> therefore is the army <S%H2428><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Syria <S%H758><s%> escaped <S%H4422><s%> out of your hand. <S%H3027><s%>

Weren't <S%H3569><s%> the Ethiopians and the Lubim <S%H3864><s%> a huge <S%H7230><s%> army, <S%H2428><s%> with chariots <S%H7393><s%> and horsemen <S%H6571><s%> exceeding <S%H3966><s%> many? <S%H7235><s%> Yet, <S%H8172><s%> because you relied on Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> he delivered <S%H5414><s%> them into your hand. <S%H3027><s%>

For the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> run back and forth <S%H7751><s%> throughout the whole earth, <S%H776><s%> to show himself strong <S%H2388><s%> in the behalf of them whose heart <S%H3824><s%> is perfect <S%H8003><s%> toward him. <S%H5528><s%> Herein you have done foolishly; for from henceforth <S%H6258><s%> you shall have <S%H3426><s%> wars. <S%H4421><s%>"

Then Asa <S%H609><s%> was angry <S%H3707><s%> with the seer, <S%H7200><s%> and put <S%H5414><s%> him in the prison; <S%H4115><s%> <S%H1004><s%> for he was in a rage <S%H2197><s%> with him because of this thing. <S%H609><s%> Asa oppressed <S%H7533><s%> some of the people <S%H5971><s%> at the same time. <S%H6256><s%>

Behold, <S%H1697><s%> the acts of Asa, <S%H609><s%> first <S%H7223><s%> and last, <S%H314><s%> behold, <S%H3789><s%> they are written in the book <S%H5612><s%> of the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> and Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

In the thirty <S%H7970><s%> - ninth <S%H8672><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of his reign <S%H4438><s%> Asa <S%H609><s%> was diseased <S%H2456><s%> in his feet; <S%H7272><s%> his disease <S%H2483><s%> was exceeding <S%H4605><s%> great: <S%H2483><s%> yet in his disease he didn't <S%H1875><s%> seek Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> but to the physicians. <S%H7495><s%>
Asa <S%H609><s%> slept <S%H7901><s%> with his fathers, <S%H1><s%> and died <S%H4191><s%> in the one <S%H259><s%> and fortieth <S%H705><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of his reign. <S%H4427><s%>

They buried <S%H6912><s%> him in his own tombs, <S%H6913><s%> which he had dug <S%H3738><s%> out for himself in the city <S%H5892><s%> of David, <S%H1732><s%> and laid <S%H7901><s%> him in the bed <S%H4904><s%> which was filled <S%H4390><s%> with sweet odors <S%H1314><s%> and various kinds <S%H2177><s%> of spices prepared <S%H7543><s%> by the perfumers <S%H4842><s%>' art: <S%H4639><s%> and they made <S%H8313><s%> a very <S%H3966><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> burning for him. <S%H8316><s%>
